sen.j: 生野県（いくのけん）は、1869年（明治2年）に設置された県。
sen.e: Ikuno Prefecture is a prefecture established in 1869.
Ikuno Prefecture was a prefecture that was established in 1869.
Ikuno Prefecture was a prefecture that was established in 1869.

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）、府県統合により消滅した。
sen.e: It was abolished because of the unification of prefectures.
It was abolished because of the unification of prefectures.
It was abolished because of the unification of prefectures in 1871.
sen.cmt: 1871年（明治4年）→訳漏れのため訳出しました。

sen.j: 1868年（慶応4年）、丹後国、丹波国、但馬国、播磨国、美作国5ヶ国の久美浜代官所、生野奉行支配地および但馬、丹波の旗本領は久美浜県となっていたが、生野代官所支配地を中心に分離運動が高まり、但馬（一部除く）、播磨、美作3カ国の地域が生野県として分離され、成立した。
sen.e: Places dominated by Kumihama or Ikuno magistrate's office in the five provinces of Tango, Tanba, Tajima, Harima and Mimasaka, and the Hatamoto domain in Tanba was already consolidated into Kumihama Prefecture, but as separatist movements grew in places dominated by Ikuno magistrate's office, Tajima (except a part of it), Harima and Mimasaka area was separated and consolidated into Ikuno Prefecture.

Places dominated by Kumihama or Ikuno magistrate's office in the five provinces of Tango, Tanba, Tajima, Harima and Mimasaka, and the Hatamoto domain in Tanba was already consolidated into Kumihama Prefecture, but as separatist movements grew in places dominated by Ikuno magistrate's office, Tajima (except a part of it), Harima, and Mimasaka areas were separated and consolidated into Ikuno Prefecture.

In 1868, places dominated by Kumihama or Ikuno magistrate's office in the five provinces of Tango, Tanba, Tajima, Harima and Mimasaka, and the Hatamoto domain in Tajima and Tanba were already consolidated into Kumihama Prefecture, but as separatist movements grew in places dominated by Ikuno magistrate's office, Tajima (except a part of it), Harima, and Mimasaka areas were separated and consolidated into Ikuno Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 「1868年（慶応4年）」「但馬」→訳漏れのため訳出、was→wereに修正

sen.j: この時、播磨国内の旗本領、藩の飛び地の一部が編入された。
sen.e: At that time, Hatamoto domain in Harima Province and a part of outland of the domain were incorporated into Ikuno Prefecture.
At that time, the Hatamoto domain in Harima Province and a part of the outlands of the domain were incorporated into Ikuno Prefecture.
At that time, the Hatamoto domain in Harima Province and a part of the outlands of the domain were incorporated into Ikuno Prefecture.

sen.j: 県庁は旧生野代官所（兵庫県朝来市）に置かれた。
sen.e: The prefecture government was located at former Ikuno magistrate's office (Asago City, Hyogo Prefecture).
The prefectural government was located at the former Ikuno magistrate's office (Asago City, Hyogo Prefecture).
The prefectural government was located at the former Ikuno magistrate's office (Asago City, Hyogo Prefecture).

sen.j: 廃藩置県では旧幕府領、旧藩がそのまま府県となっていたため飛び地が多かった。
sen.e: Under the policy of Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), former domains became prefectures, therefore there were a lot of outlands.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Under the policy of Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), former domains became prefectures, therefore there were a lot of overlooked lands.
Under the policy of Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), former domains became prefectures, therefore there were a lot of overlooked lands.

sen.j: この問題を解消するために1871年（明治4年）終盤に府県統合が行われた。
sen.e: In order to solve the problem, consolidation of prefectures was carried out in late 1871.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In order to solve the problem, a consolidation of prefectures was carried out in late 1871.
In order to solve the problem, a consolidation of prefectures was carried out in late 1871.

sen.j: 但馬国一円は豊岡県、播磨国一円は姫路県、美作国一円が北条県として統合されることになり、生野県は消滅した。
sen.e: The whole of Tajima, Harima and Mimasaka Province were consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture, Himeji Prefecture and Hojo Prefecture, respectively, and Ikuno Prefecture was abolished.
The whole of Tajima, Harima and Mimasaka Province were consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture, Himeji Prefecture and Hojo Prefecture, respectively, and Ikuno Prefecture was abolished.
The whole of Tajima, Harima and Mimasaka Province were consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture, Himeji Prefecture and Hojo Prefecture, respectively, and Ikuno Prefecture was abolished.
History
History
History

sen.j: 1868年（慶応4年）4月19日 (旧暦)、旧生野代官支配地を統治する府中裁判所が設置
sen.e: On April 19, 1868 (old calendar), Fuchu Court was established to rule the area formerly dominated by Ikuno magistrate's office.
On April 19, 1868 (old calendar), Fuchu Court was established to rule the area formerly dominated by Ikuno magistrate's office.
May 11, 1868: Fuchu Court was established to rule the area formerly dominated by Ikuno magistrate's office.
sen.cmt: 統一事項より、旧暦表記→新暦に修正「年月日: 」形式に変更

sen.j: 1868年（慶応4年）閏4月28日 (旧暦)、旧久美浜支配地を統括する久美浜県が発足
sen.e: On April 28, 1868, Kumihama Prefecture was established to rule the former Kumihama dominated area.
On April 28, 1868, Kumihama Prefecture was established to rule the former Kumihama dominated area.
June 18, 1868: Kumihama Prefecture was established to rule the former Kumihama dominated area.
sen.cmt: 新暦に修正「年月日: 」形式に変更

sen.j: 1868年（慶応4年）7月29日 (旧暦)、府中裁判所が廃止され、久美浜県に編入（23万石）
sen.e: On June 29, 1868, Fuchu Court was abolished and incorporated into Kumihama Prefecture (230,000 koku).
On June 29, 1868, Fuchu Court was abolished and incorporated into Kumihama Prefecture (230,000 koku).
September 15, 1868: Fuchu Court was abolished and incorporated into Kumihama Prefecture (230,000 koku).
sen.cmt: 新暦に修正「年月日: 」形式に変更

sen.j: 1869年（明治2年）8月10日 (旧暦)、久美浜県のうち但馬（一部除く）、播磨、美作3カ国が分離し、生野県が設置
sen.e: On August 10, 1869, Tajima (except a part), Harima and Mimasaka were separated from Kumihama Prefecture and consolidated into Ikuno Prefecture.
On August 10, 1869, Tajima (except a part), Harima and Mimasaka were separated from Kumihama Prefecture and consolidated into Ikuno Prefecture.
September 15, 1869: Tajima (except a part), Harima and Mimasaka were separated from Kumihama Prefecture and consolidated into Ikuno Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 新暦に修正「年月日: 」形式に変更

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）11月2日 (旧暦)、豊岡県および姫路県が設置
sen.e: On November 2, 1871, Toyooka and Himeji Prefectures were established.
On November 2, 1871, Toyooka and Himeji Prefectures were established.
December 13, 1871: Toyooka and Himeji Prefectures were established.
sen.cmt: 新暦に修正「年月日: 」形式に変更

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）11月15日 (旧暦)、北条県が発足。生野県廃止
sen.e: On November 15, 1871, Hojo Prefecture was established and Ikuno Prefecture was abolished.
On November 15, 1871, Hojo Prefecture was established and Ikuno Prefecture was abolished.
December 26, 1871: Hojo Prefecture was established and Ikuno Prefecture was abolished.
sen.cmt: 新暦に修正「年月日: 」形式に変更
